SelectionTitle: S001. About Scott Electric and Welcome to Training
Title: S001. About Scott Electric and Welcome to Training
Title_short: About Scott Electric and Welcome to Training
Narr1: Scott Electric is a leading independent wholesale electrical distributor
Narr2: Scott Electric is a leading independent wholesale electrical distributor, serving electrical, mechanical, and general contractors, industrial customers, government agencies, and retail partners.
Narr3:
Scott Electric is a leading independent wholesale electrical distributor, serving electrical, mechanical, and general contractors, industrial customers, government agencies, and retail partners. The company provides a broad range of electrical products, lighting, tools, and related services to support both day-to-day operations and long-term projects.

Welcome to the Scott Electric Training SiteWelcome to the Scott Electric Training Site. This platform is designed to help you build the knowledge and skills needed to support our customers safely, accurately, and efficiently. Here you will find guided learning, reference materials, and role-based courses aligned with how we work every day — in sales, operations, service, administration, and support.Thank you for investing your time in training. Your commitment to learning and improvement is an important part of keeping Scott Electric strong, responsive, and customer-focused.

SelectionTitle: S1.  Initiate Quote – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: S1. Initiate Quote - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Narr2: This process actually starts outside the info system i
Narr3: This process actually starts outside the info system in the real world where a customer either sends in an RFQ or requests for quote or calls in in some cases even sends an email with an excel requesting a quote All these actions basically lead to the creation or initiation of a court That step is called Initiate Quote. In this step the operator enters the customer name or selects it from the dropdown also selects the fact that this is a quote and not a stock order or any other kind of order Then they enter all other pertinent information needed to create or initiate at which time when the when the operator its next a quote number is generated

Title: S2. Enter Quote lines - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Narr2: Having created or opened a quote the next most importan
Narr3: Having created or opened a quote the next most important thing is The next most important thing is to enter the lines that the customer needs added to the quote so it requires there are multiple ways of entering the line items but let's assume that no matter what at the end of the day one has to select a product and once they've entered the product they need to select the quantity needed at which time they need to see if it is available and there is part of that screen also allows the sales order entry person to basically look for availability of that inventory within the company but in a different warehouse then the standard warehouse for that customer

Narr2: Once all the lines were entered the next most
Narr3: Once all the lines were entered the next most important thing is to verify that the totals matched what was expected also to make sure that the tax for all the lines are being calculated at the rate levels because depending upon the destination or the source depending also upon which bounty within which state the taxes change there are other implications too Taxes change based on product and the customer having a exemption certificate because they're working on a particular kind of project which gives them tax relief So this is a very critical step

SelectionTitle: S4a.  Send Quote and await response – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: S4a. Send Quote and await response - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title_short: S4a. Send Quote and await response
Narr2: Having created the quote
Narr3: Having created the quote entered the lines entered the taxes and any other additional charges it is now time to do one quick check to make sure that everything is as discussed with the customer and meets the customer's requirements Then it's now time to ship this port or send the Quote to the customer

SelectionTitle: D1.  Status of the Quote – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: D1. Status of the Quote - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Narr2: Having received a response from the customer now it has to be determined whether
Narr3: Having received a response from the customer now it has to be determined whether the customer accepted our quote or has rejected it or has suggested some changes no matter what there's basically a decision point and hence this step is demarcated with the number T one indicating that there is a decision that needs to be taken and the decision is was the quote accepted or was it not accepted I don't want to say rejected because they may not accept the quote in totality but they may want some changes or may indicate some changes that we need to make in order to get that business of course Scott Electric has to take a decision too if those changes are something that Scott Electric is willing to provide or it in the greater good the decision is taken that it is better to lose the business than except those terms that the customer is expecting Either way there's only two outcomes that can happen from here one is yes it was accepted and no it was not accepted
Disp_next1: Yes the Customer Accepted the Quote

SelectionTitle: Y1.  Yes the Customer Accepted the Quote – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: Y1. Yes the Customer Accepted the Quote - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title_short: Yes the Customer Accepted the Quote
Narr1: yes the customer has accepted the quote
Narr2: A Yes decision was taken
Narr3: As a practice it should be mentioned here that all the flows are designed to first negotiate the yes links as far as possible and then come back to each decision point and take the null link so with that in mind the next step is of course Y1 yes the customer has accepted the quote so there are additional processes that must happen now that we know that the Quote has been accepted

SelectionTitle: D2.  Was special Pricing given – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: D2. Was special Pricing given - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Narr2: Once the Quote is then verified based on if there's any other additional te
Narr3: Once the Quote is then verified based on if there's any other additional terms or any other requests that the customer has made for example they may accept the quote in entirety as far as the product the value everything else but may choose that parts of it has to be shipped to another project within their organization so these are kind of small nuances that are verified but more importantly in order to win this business it is quite probable that some pricing changes were made to be competitive and to garner the customer's business So the next this leads to the next decision point  D-2 were any special pricing provided for this project And the two possible options are yes or Y two the there was special pricing created to garner this business or the other option end to in which case the prices quoted were the standard price for that customer class and that customer so that decision has to be taken

SelectionTitle: Y2.  Yes, Special Pricing was utilized – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: Y2. Yes, Special Pricing was utilized - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Narr2: Since it was determined th
Narr3: Since it was determined that a special price arrangement was made for this particular quote the quote has to be converted to a pricing record so that there will be history of the special pricing given and also that helps us analyze as a business how well our pricing promotions etcetera are effective in gardening

SelectionTitle: S5.  Copy Quote to Price Record – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: S5. Copy Quote to Price Record - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Source_Title: Convert A Quote To A Pricing Record
Narr2: This business was won by giv
Narr3: This business was won by giving the customer a special price on the lines with the order hence the quote needs to copied to a price record. This helps ensure the price is mainted through the life of the Quote fro quote to cash. It also provides the pricing department with valuable information for analysis on price effectiveness etc

Title: D3. Is there an opportunity to Requote ?- SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title_short: Is there an opportunity to Requote ?
Deci_Question: Is there an opportunity to requote?
Narr1: Is there an opportunity to Requote ?
Narr2: Is every good and successful salesperson knows that the sale only starts when there is a rejection o
Narr3: Is every good and successful salesperson knows that the sale only starts when there is a rejection otherwise it's just a demand right so the fact that the quote was not accepted does not mean that's the end of it A good salesperson who has a good relationship with the customer typically will look for ways to carve out some portion or the whole business and in so doing comes up with a need to recoat the to the customer Well sometimes life is hard and one cannot always win everything so that's why it's called life right And hence if there is no opportunity for a Quote because it also comes to light and a good customer will know a good salesperson will know when a customer has already taken action to go with someone else and at that point there is the process of saying no we there is no opportunity to reQuote So as I said there are two possible decisions one is there an opportunity to reQuote or the other is there no opportunity to reQuote and this is the last business

SelectionTitle: S8. Ensure to Record the reason for the lost business – SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title: S8. Ensure to Record the reason for the lost business - SE Quote to Sales Order SOP
Title_short: Ensure to Record the reason for the lost business
Narr1: Ensure to Record the reason for the lost business
Narr2: As hard as it might be to concede defeat it is very important to document the reason why we did not
Narr3: As hard as it might be to concede defeat it is very important to document the reason why we did not get this business Wasn't due to price wasn't due to availability of stock was it due to other specifications that we could not match 100% for example there are many shades of wall plates We might have the generic ivory and the customer may be looking for a specific brand specific color which we don't carry in inventory we would be glad to have it shipped to them directly but that may not have met their time requirements hence in cases like this is very important to note why that line or the lines were rejected by the customer and if many such votes are lost because of product availability etc Product stock information can be adjusted and those products can be kept in our standing inventory
